intro.description: This tutorial guides you through the creation of a database connection.

item.title: Create the Database Connection
item.description:
To open the DB Connection wizard, expand the Metadata node. Then, right click DB connections and select Create connection(or click the link below).
This wizard prompts you to provide the connection metadata and authentication information and creates a connection to your DBMS (DataBase Management System). Upon completion, the database content is added to the DQ Repository tree view.

item.title: The Database Content
item.description: Note: Regardless of the name attributed to the Database, all of its accessible content is displayed in the DQ Repository tree view. This allows you to examine its content even if you do not know the names of all of the catalogs (or schemata). A database can contain either catalogs or schemata or both. The structural content depends on the type of DBMS. Click on the question mark above for further information.
